data.title: Healthy Eating
data.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Crazy Bowls and Wraps serves good healthy food. My favorite menu item is the plentiful multi-grain salad, with greens, quinoa, rice, avacodos, and more. You can add toppings from a variety of choices at the beverage and condiment station to customize your meal.  CBW is a clean, friendly, modern designed restaurant that includes dine in, drive-through, carry out, call-ahead service. Convenient location near major grocery store and university.

data.title: Good but expensive for a wrap
data.text: The ingredients are fresh and the food tastes good, but if you're going to charge $8-$10 for a wrap, it should come with a side of something.  I feel like it's way too expensive.

data.title: So many healthy choices
data.text: Where do you begin...you can slant it Chinese style or Mexican or "Californian" based on what spices/sauces and vegetables or the cold VS hot version.  Many gluten free and just plain healthy options.  Love the Tea bar and the dressings bar.  Must always have a little cup of the buffalo dressing on the side for dipping meat in.  Not sure what I will try next time...a salad??  Flavors are amazing as well as the combos of the proteins and veggies.  They aren't too used to selling gift cards and had to call the manager for help.  Each card has to be billed separately (weird).  Plus they are having a gift card special now, when you buy $50 in gift cards you get a separate $5 one (but it has to be 1- $50 card not multiple cards equalling $50...crazy stupid idea).  Not worth spending the $50 on that.
